title: Ticket #2238: condor-reuse-slot* user shows up on logon screen for win64*
remarks:
2011-Jun-15 15:35:50 by ziliang:
I looked into whether disabling the account would still permit Condor to use it, but it won't work. Mirroring info into the 64bit registry seems to be the only way to fix the issue.

2011-Jun-16 12:51:48 by tstclair:
Tested modifications under V7_6-winslotuser-publicbranch on Win7, and it appears to behave correctly.

2011-Jun-21 14:01:38 by johnkn:
KEY_WOW64_64KEY is ignored by 32 bit windows, so the conditional test for Is64BitWindows adds no value. Since that function doesn't belong in that module anyway please just remove it and make the flag unconditional. -tj

2011-Jun-21 14:21:10 by tstclair:
I think it's a worth while future proofing effort so I plan to leave. But your comments are duly noted.

2011-Jun-21 14:36:10 by tstclair:
patch rejected as currently written. The conditional adds no value, and is in any case incorrect if you are thinking of future 64 bit Condor. please make the requested change.

2011-Jun-21 15:07:23 by tstclair:
Commented out.
check_ins:
2011-Jun-21 15:23   Check-in [22248]: === GT #2238 === Update to move to common loc yet remain commented out. (By Timothy St. Clair )
2011-Jun-21 15:04   Check-in [22245]: === GT #2238 === Comment out 64-bit check re:code review. (By Timothy St. Clair )
2011-Jun-16 12:55   Check-in [22210]: === GT #2238 === Write hidden slot user keys in 64 bit registry if on a 64-bit machine. (By Timothy St. Clair )
creator: tstclair
